title: Canker Sores Causes, Cure, Medicine, Home Remedies & Pain
author: Medical Author John P Cunha; DO; FACOEP Medical Editor Jerry R Balentine; FACEP
description: Canker sores are small painful sores on the inside of the mouth. Learn about canker sore home remedies, medications, treatment, causes, and symptoms.

They may occur on the tongue and the inside linings of the cheeks, lips, and throat. They usually appear white, gray, or yellow, with a red border. - Canker sores are among the most common types of oral lesions, affecting about 20% of people. - Women get canker sores more often than men. [Canker sore](https://www.medicinenet.com/image-collection/cold_sore_and_canker_sore_picture/picture.htm)susceptibility may be [inherited](https://www.medicinenet.com/genetic_disease/article.htm), and the condition can run in families. What are three types of canker sores? Canker sores are not the same as [cold sores](https://www.medicinenet.com/herpes_simplex_infections_non-genital/article.htm) ( [fever blisters](https://www.medicinenet.com/herpes_simplex_infections_non-genital/article.htm)), which are an infection caused by the [herpes](https://www.medicinenet.com/stds_pictures_slideshow/article.htm) virus and are [contagious](https://www.medicinenet.com/contagious_quiz/quiz.htm). Canker sores are not contagious, and are categorized into three types: - Minor sores measure from 3 to 10 millimeters (mm) and are the most common type of canker sore. Lesions last 10 to 14 days and heal without scarring. - Major sores are larger and deeper than minor sores, have an irregular border, and have a diameter of greater than 10 mm. Major canker sores may take weeks to months to heal and can leave a [scar](https://www.medicinenet.com/scars/article.htm)after healing. - Herpetiform sores are characterized by large groups of multiple sores. These are small ulcers (2-3 mm) but there may be as many as 100 ulcers present at the same time. They tend to heal without scarring. What are the main causes of canker sores? The cause of most canker sores is not well understood, and multiple factors may cause sores to appear. Some possible causes of canker sores include the following: - Injury to the mouth may cause simple canker sores. The injury could be from vigorous tooth brushing, dental work, [braces](https://www.medicinenet.com/dental_braces/article.htm)or [dentures](https://www.medicinenet.com/dentures/article.htm), or a sports accident. - Acidic foods, including citrus fruits, may trigger a canker sore or make it worse. - Food sensitivities or [allergies](https://www.medicinenet.com/allergy/article.htm)(anything from highly acidic foods to [chocolate](https://www.medicinenet.com/chocolate_pictures_slideshow/article.htm)and coffee) [Toothpaste](https://www.medicinenet.com/choosing_a_toothpaste/article.htm)containing sodium lauryl sulfate [Allergy](https://www.medicinenet.com/allergy/article.htm)to certain bacteria in the mouth - Hormones - Emotional [stress](https://www.medicinenet.com/stress/article.htm) [Smoking](https://www.medicinenet.com/smoking_and_quitting_smoking/article.htm) - Gastrointestinal tract diseases such as [Celiac disease](https://www.medicinenet.com/celiac_disease_gluten_enteropathy/article.htm)or - Autoimmune disorders such as [systemic lupus erythematosus](https://www.medicinenet.com/systemic_lupus_erythematosus_quiz/quiz.htm)or Behçet's disease - Other immune system weaknesses such as a [cold](https://www.medicinenet.com/common_cold/article.htm)or the [flu](https://www.medicinenet.com/influenza/article.htm), [HIV/AIDS](https://www.medicinenet.com/hiv_aids_myths_and_facts_pictures_slideshow/article.htm), or an organ transplant - Systemic conditions such as Crohn's disease or nutritional deficiencies [Oral cancer](https://www.medicinenet.com/oral_cancer_symptoms_and_signs/symptoms.htm) - - [](https://www.medicinenet.com/cold_sores_pictures_slideshow/article.htm) SLIDESHOWSee Slideshow Are canker sores the same thing as cold sores (fever blisters)? No, canker sores are not the same thing as [cold sores](https://www.medicinenet.com/cold_sores_pictures_slideshow/article.htm) ( [fever blisters](https://www.medicinenet.com/image-collection/cold_sores_fever_blisters_picture/picture.htm)). - Canker sores occur inside the mouth and are not contagious. [Fever blisters](https://www.medicinenet.com/oral_herpes_cold_sores_symptoms_and_signs/symptoms.htm)are infections caused by the herpes simplex virus (HSV), they mostly occur on the lips and outside of the mouth, and they are very contagious. What are signs and symptoms of canker sores? Canker sores are painful sores inside the mouth. They may occur on the tongue, the lining of the cheeks, the gums, the inside of the lips, or the soft palate on the back of the roof of your mouth. Common symptoms of canker sores include the following: - A burning, tingling, or prickling sensation, up to 24 hours before the sore appears - Crater-like ulcers that are white, gray, or yellow, with a red border - Sores are usually painful - Difficulty speaking, eating, or swallowing Less common symptoms that can also indicate a more serious underlying infection include: [Fever](https://www.medicinenet.com/aches_pain_fever/article.htm) [Swollen lymph nodes](https://www.medicinenet.com/swollen_lymph_nodes/article.htm) - Sluggishness [Weight loss](https://www.medicinenet.com/weight_loss/article.htm) [Thrush](https://www.medicinenet.com/thrush/article.htm)infection in your mouth or throat Contact your doctor or dentist if your canker sores are the following: - Larger than usual - Spreading - Lasting more than three weeks - Causing severe [pain](https://www.medicinenet.com/pain_management/article.htm)even after taking [over-the-counter](https://www.medicinenet.com/over-the-counter_products/article.htm) [pain](https://www.medicinenet.com/pain_quiz/quiz.htm)medication - Causing difficulty drinking enough fluids to stay hydrated - Accompanied by [fever](https://www.medicinenet.com/fever/symptoms.htm) What topical prescription and over-the-counter medications cure canker sores? Topical gels or ointments are used for canker sores to relieve pain, decrease inflammation, and prevent infection. - Topical pain medications: Gels such as benzocaine (Orajel, Orabase) and [lidocaine](https://www.medicinenet.com/lidocaine_patch-topical/article.htm)(an anesthetic) are used directly on the canker sore to relieve pain or discomfort. Canker sore patches (Canker Cover) provide pain relief while covering and protecting the sore as it heals. These types of medications can be found over the counter. Topical anti-inflammatory medications: Steroid medications such as triamcinolone acetonide or fluocinonide can be used topically to decrease inflammation from canker sores. These medications usually require a prescription and should be used exactly as your doctor or other health care professional has instructed. - Topical antibiotics: These medications may be prescribed by your doctor or dentist if there is a possibility of the canker sore becoming infected with bacteria. Redness, crusting, pus discharge, or fever are signs of infection. What oral medications are available to cure canker sores? Several oral medications may help relieve symptoms of canker sores, such as: What 14 natural or home remedies cure canker sores? In most cases, canker sores do not require any treatment, and there is nothing specific you need to do to get rid of a canker sore because it usually will heal on its own. Home remedies can be used to help relieve the pain and inflammation of canker sores. If you already have a canker sore, there are home remedies that can be used to help relieve the pain or irritation caused by the sore and to speed healing: - Topical medications applied directly on the sore, mouthwashes, and oral medications can relieve pain or inflammation. - Allow ice chips to dissolve slowly in your mouth for relief of pain. - Avoid acidic foods such as citrus fruits or spicy foods that may aggravate the sore. - If there is any vitamin deficiency (a doctor can test for this), take supplementation as prescribed. - Brush [teeth](https://www.medicinenet.com/habits_that_wreck_your_teeth_pictures_slideshow/article.htm)gently and use a brush with soft bristles. - Use toothpaste and mouthwash that does not contain sodium lauryl sulfate. - Another home remedy is to mix milk of magnesia with [Benadryl](https://www.medicinenet.com/diphenhydramine/article.htm)liquid and use it as a mouth rinse. You can also dab milk of magnesia directly onto the canker sore with a cotton swab. - Rinse your mouth with salt water or baking soda rinse. Mix 1 teaspoon of baking soda per ½ cup water, and rinse. - Other natural remedies include [goldenseal](https://www.medicinenet.com/goldenseal_hydrastis_canadensis-oral/article.htm)mouth rinse, deglycyrrhizinated [licorice](https://www.medicinenet.com/licorice_glycyrrhiza_glabra-oral/article.htm)(DGL) gargled in warm water, and saltwater rinses. - Zinc lozenges may help provide relief and speed healing time. Do not give lozenges to young children, as they may be a choking risk. [Vitamin C](https://www.medicinenet.com/ascorbic_acid-oral/article.htm), [vitamin B complex](https://www.medicinenet.com/vitamin_b_complex-oral/article.htm), and lysine can be taken orally when lesions first appear and may help speed healing. - Infuse sage and chamomile herbs in water and use them as a mouthwash four to six times daily. - The herb [Echinacea](https://www.medicinenet.com/echinacea_echinacea_sp-oral/article.htm)may help speed healing. - Carrot, celery, and cantaloupe juices may also be helpful. Consult a health care professional before using any home remedy as many have not been scientifically tested or proven effective. Does mouthwash help canker sores? Several mouthwash solutions may be treat canker sore symptoms, including: [Diphenhydramine](https://www.medicinenet.com/diphenhydramine/article.htm)suspension (Benadryl [Allergy](https://www.medicinenet.com/10_common_allergy_triggers_slideshow/article.htm)liquid) is available over the counter and can be used as a mouth rinse because it has topical anesthetic effects on the tissue of the mouth and the canker sore. Put the suspension in your mouth, swish it around for 30 seconds to one minute, and spit it out. Do not swallow the rinse. - Anti-inflammatory steroid mouth rinses may be prescribed to help reduce inflammation of the sores. [Tetracycline](https://www.medicinenet.com/tetracycline/article.htm)antibiotic rinses may be prescribed and have been shown to relieve the pain and promote the healing of canker sores. Do not use tetracycline if you are [pregnant](https://www.medicinenet.com/pregnancy_symptoms_and_signs/symptoms.htm), people [allergic](https://www.medicinenet.com/allergy/article.htm)to tetracycline, or if the person with the canker sore is a child under 16 years of age. What should a person do if they get recurrent or chronic canker sores? If a person suffers from frequent canker sores, there may be an underlying medical reason or illness that causes them. See a health care professional or dentist if there are any concerns that canker sores are frequent. Predisposition to canker sores may just be genetic. However, some diseases that affect the immune system such as [lupus](https://www.medicinenet.com/systemic_lupus/article.htm), Crohn's disease, [celiac disease](https://www.medicinenet.com/celiac_disease_symptoms_and_signs/symptoms.htm), or [HIV/AIDS](https://www.medicinenet.com/hiv-aids_quiz/quiz.htm) may cause frequent or recurrent canker sores. Healthcare professionals can order tests to determine if there is an underlying medical reason for a person's frequent canker sores. When these allergens come in contact with the body, it causes the immune system to develop an allergic reaction in people who are allergic to it. It is estimated that 50 million North Americans are affected by allergic conditions. The parts of the body that are prone to react to allergies include the eyes, nose, lungs, skin, and stomach.
